metadata.title: Supporting data for 'A data-driven approach to identifying and evaluating connectivity-based neural correlates of consciousness'
metadata.description:
This Zenodo repository contains all intermediate data needed to reproduce analyses in our manuscript, 'A data-driven approach to identifying and evaluating connectivity-based neural correlates of consciousness'. Please be sure to unzip the compressed folder 'data.zip' upon downloading. All analysis code can be found in the corresponding GitHub repository.

All original data was obtained from the COGITATE Consortium as part of their open data release from their adversarial collaboration initiative. Relevant links for the Consortium and their works:

  • Data publication link: https://doi.org/10.17617/1.WQA3-WK71
  • Adversarial collaboration publication: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-025-08888-1

data.title: Supporting data for 'A data-driven approach to identifying and evaluating connectivity-based neural correlates of consciousness'

metadata.title: From Market Failures to the Vulnerabilities and Logical Flaws of 'Artificial' Environmental Protection Systems
metadata.description: Following the Paris Agreement, global actors intensified climate action through ambitious pledges, financial alliances, and investments in green technologies. However, despite continued rises in atmospheric carbon concentrations and global temperatures, a series of structural regressions have emerged, exposing the deep vulnerabilities and fundamental flaws of artificial systems designed to drive socio-economic systems towards resilience. These systems, largely shaped by mainstream economic worldviews, commodify nature and rely heavily on subjective cost-benefit analyses. This article argues that such approaches cultivate an eco-deficit culture, which erodes resilience and public trust. Drawing on Granular Interaction Thinking Theory (GITT), the paper explores the roots of these systemic weaknesses and proposes a corrective mechanism: the semiconducting principle, in which environmental values may be converted into monetary equivalents but not vice versa. The article concludes by calling for the adoption of an eleventh progressive cultural value—protecting and healing nature—as foundational to building an eco-surplus culture and achieving authentic sustainability.

data.title: From Market Failures to the Vulnerabilities and Logical Flaws of 'Artificial' Environmental Protection Systems

metadata.title: Impact of UPI (Unified Payment Service) on business of Handicraft sector: A case study of Terracotta crafts at Panchmura in Bankura
metadata.description:
Abstract:

This study analyzes the role of online payment (UPI) in development of Terracotta pottery items at Panchmura village in Bankura district. Panchmura village is famous for its wide range of Terracotta items. The long neck Terracotta horse and elephants are produced in this region. This Terracotta items are very popular craft items and symbolizes the culture of the district. It not only adorns the interior of houses but having a religious values and folk identity as well. For this research a number of 50 sample artisans (respondents) were taken to collect database. Both the qualitative and quantitative data was collected to explore the role of digital payment services on sales of the pottery items and satisfaction of the customers. It also tries to explore how much online payment services influences the sell frequency, satisfaction of consumers and overall business assessment. For this analysis basic statistical tools like mean, percentage analysis, Chi-square method, rank distribution analysis is administered to found the significance of the relationship between selected variables. It is found that besides the conventional business channel (cash transaction) this online payment gives a true impetuous in pottery business and helps to secure their earning through bank transactions.

creators.name: Sen, Atanu
creators.affiliation: Asst. Professor in Geography Panchmura Mahavidyalaya, Bankura

keywords: Keywords: UPI, Terracotta, Digital payment service, customer satisfaction

journal.title: International Journal of Advance and Applied Research

data.title: Impact of UPI (Unified Payment Service) on business of Handicraft sector: A case study of Terracotta crafts at Panchmura in Bankura

metadata.title: Predicting Flight Prices by using Neural Networks and Regression
metadata.description:
The objective of the Flight Fare Prediction System is to help travellers plan their trips and manage their finances by offering accurate estimates of flight ticket prices. Frequent variations in airfare for the same flight often pose challenges for securing economical options. This predictive model resolves such issues by estimating ticket prices, helping users save money and understand price trends better. The strategy makes use of sophisticated machine learning techniques and historical flight data to ensure dependable fare predictions. Key factors, such as departure times, airlines, travel dates, destinations, and other pertinent information and analysed to discern patterns influencing pricing.

The system incorporates a number of machine learning strategies, such as Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, and Support Vector Regression. By delivering fare estimates and insights into pricing trends, this system enables users to make informed booking choices. Its integration into flight booking platforms provides a useful resource for travellers to find cost-effective options and plan trips with ease.
keywords: Machine learning, neural networks, and airline fare forecasting, Flight Data Analysis.
references: 1.	Tziridis, K. (2017, October 26). Flight prices prediction using machine learning techniques. 25th Conference on European Signal Processing (EUSIPCO), IEEE.
2.	Brown, N., & Taylor, J. (2004). Flight fare: Tales, poetry, and essays on flight. Books by Sarabande.
3.	Purey, P. (n.d.). Using neural networks and regression analysis to predict stock market close prices.
4.	ResearchGate. (n.d.). Proposed framework for airfare price prediction using public data sources. Retrieved from https://www.researchgate.net/publication/335936877
5.	EPRA Journals. (n.d.). Retrieved from https://eprajournals.com/IJSR/article/11611/download

Prokopova (Eds.), Software engineering perspectives and application in intelligent systems (Vol. 465). Springer, Cham.

10.	Patil, K. S., et al. (2022). Hybrid and adaptive cryptographic-based secure authentication approach in IoT-based applications using hybrid encryption. Pervasive and Mobile Computing, 82, 101552.

metadata.title: Unique transcriptional profiles of adult human immature neurons in healthy aging, Alzheimer's disease, and cognitive resilience
metadata.description:
Following files submitted:
1. adult_raw.RDS : Raw seurat object of the processed adult (n=24) snRNA-seq samples.
2. adult_filtered.RDS : Filtered (after QC) seurat object of the processed adult (n=24) snRNA-seq samples.
3. adultgc_filtered.RDS : Seurat object of adult granule cell subset after additional filtering (See Fig3A). 
4. fetal_raw.RDS : Raw seurat object of the processed fetal (n=3) snRNA-seq samples.
5. fetal_filtered.RDS : Filtered (after QC) seurat object of the processed fetal (n=3) snRNA-seq samples.
6. neurolin.RDS : Seurat object of fetal neurogenic lineage subset (See Fig2D). 
7. Functions.R : Helper functions written for running scripts.
8. Fig1_script.Rmd : Script to reproduce analysis in Figure 1 and its supplementaries.
9. Fig2_script.Rmd : Script to reproduce analysis in Figure 2 and its supplementaries.
10. Fig3_script.Rmd : Script to reproduce analysis in Figure 3 and its supplementaries.
11. Fig4_script.Rmd : Script to reproduce analysis in Figure 4 and its supplementaries.
12. Fig5_script.Rmd : Script to reproduce analysis in Figure 5 and its supplementaries.
13. Fig6_script.Rmd : Script to reproduce analysis in Figure 6 and its supplementaries.

data.title: Unique transcriptional profiles of adult human immature neurons in healthy aging, Alzheimer's disease, and cognitive resilience

metadata.title: Artificial Intelligence in Medication Adherence and Personalized Treatment Plans
metadata.description: Adherence to medication and personalized treatment constitute the cornerstones of effective chronic disease management, yet the realization of their intent remains challenged by patient-specific, therapeutic, and systemic barriers. Due to the advancing availability of big health data and computational techniques, AI has made its stride into the health scenario as a disruptive force. This review discusses a variety of AI-powered tools used to monitor and enhance medication adherence—smart pill bottles, ingestible sensors, wearables, mHealth apps, and predictive analytics—and their incorporation into real-time clinical decision-making. We further discuss AI's role in developing personalized treatment regimens based on genomic data, adaptive algorithms, and electronic health records (EHR). The ethics of these challenges, including data privacy, algorithmic bias, and accountability, are further elucidated, alongside issues of in-field implementation. Lastly, along with the topics mentioned earlier, the review talks about future ideas like explainable AI, federated learning, and closed-loop adherence systems, which could help make AI a key part of personalized, proactive, and fair healthcare.

creators.name: Akanksha Kukade*, Sayali kawade, Sonakshi lokare, Ankita kharage

keywords: Artificial Intelligence, Medication Adherence, Personalized Treatment, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Smart Healthcare, Clinical Decision Support, Digital Health, EHR Integration, Ethics in AI

journal.title: International Journal of Scientific Research and Technology

data.title: Artificial Intelligence in Medication Adherence and Personalized Treatment Plans

metadata.title: Voice-Driven Medical Department Recommendation: Integrating Named Entity Recognition with Distinct Clustering and Multi-Class Classification on Unlabeled and Labeled Data For Enhanced Analysis
metadata.description: Through the integration of cutting-edge natural language processing techniques, this multidisciplinary research project seeks to improve the accuracy and reach of voice-driven medical department classification. For nuanced language comprehension, K-means clustering efficiently divides data using Clinical BERT. Integrating the Med7 and BC5CDR models helps Named Entity Recognition (NER) by making it easier to thoroughly identify and categorize things in medical records. In order to enhance contextual analysis and capture sequential relationships, LSTM networks are used for multi-class classification in conjunction with distinct BiLSTM and CRF models. To improve the classification process, a CNN model is also included to extract features from input data. This integrated framework provides useful insights into voice-driven medical record analysis and advances automated healthcare systems by working seamlessly with both labeled and unlabeled data. It has a great deal of potential to revolutionize the field. The following are the model accuracy rates: CNN 97%, CRF 78%, LSTM 76%, and BiLSTM 67%. Unlabeled patient data was grouped using K-means clustering, which shed light on how symptoms impact cluster formation and convergence.
keywords: Medical Department Recommendation, Named Entity Recognition, K-means Clustering, Conditional Random Field, Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers
references: 1.	Miah, M. S. U., Sulaiman, J., Sarwar, T. B., Islam, S. S., Rahman, M., & Haque, M. S. (2023). Medical named entity recognition (MedNER): A deep learning model for recognizing medical entities (drug, disease) from scientific texts. IEEE EUROCON  2023 - 20th International Conference on Smart Technologies, 158–162.
2.	Liu, N., Hu, Q., Xu, H., Xu, X., & Chen, M. (2022). Med-BERT: A pretraining framework for medical records named entity recognition. IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics, 18(8), 5600–5608.
3.	Cui, Z., Yuan, Z., Wu, Y., Sun, X., & Yu, K. (2023). Intelligent recommendation for departments based on medical knowledge graph. IEEE Access, 11, 25372–25385.

4.	Moqurrab, S. A., Ayub, U., Anjum, A., Asghar, S., & Srivastava, G. (2021). An accurate deep learning model for clinical entity recognition from clinical notes. IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics, 25(10), 3804–3811.
5.	Kim, H., & Kang, J. (2022). How do your biomedical named entity recognition models generalize to novel entities? IEEE Access, 10, 31513–31523.

6.	Batbaatar, E., & Ryu, K. (2019). Ontology-based healthcare named entity recognition from Twitter messages using a recurrent neural network approach. International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health.
7.	Wen, C., Chen, T., Jia, X., & Zhu, J. (2020). Medical named entity recognition from unlabelled medical records based on pre-trained language models and domain dictionary. Data Intelligence.

8.	Reddy, V. M., Vaishnavi, T., & Kumar, K. P. (2023). Speech-to-text and text-to-speech recognition using deep learning. 2023 2nd International Conference on Edge Computing and Applications (ICECAA), 657–666.
9.	Meng, H., Zhang, L., & Zhang, D. (2023). Retracted: Named entity recognition of medical text based on the deep neural network. Journal of Healthcare Engineering, 2023, Article ID 9805297.

10.	Rehman, T., Sanyal, D. K., Majumder, P., & Chattopadhyay, S. (2022). Named entity recognition based automatic generation of research highlights. In Proceedings of the Third Workshop on Scholarly Document Processing, arXiv:2303.12795, 163–169.

metadata.title: Predicting Medal Counts In Olympics Using Machine Learning Algorithm
metadata.description: The major international sports that occur once in every four years are Olympics ,has more than 200 participant nations. It is used for preventing whether the Atlantic is too winning a win a medal in the Olympic game . the studies on Olympic are expecting to predict the total number of medals of The nation and possible to achieve further or country’s performance All the country should do analyse to evaluate previous performance so they get to know their mistake and help to grow in the further. Machine learning in particular boosting algorithms, it has an influence it improves in prediction models.
keywords: Olympic game, machine learning algorithm, Olympic medals predication.
